greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Smallest square formed from n by inserting zero or more decimal digits.
comment: The digits may be added before, in the middle of, or after the digits of n.
If n is a square then a(n) = n. - _Zak Seidov_, Nov 13 2014
link: Michael De Vlieger, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
example: Smallest square formed from 20 is 2025, by placing 25 on the right side. Smallest square formed from 33 is 3136, by inserting a 1 between 3's and placing a 6.
maple: for dmas from 2^plen-1 to 0 by -1 do
for i from 1 to nops(dmasdigs) do
mathematica: IntegerDigits@ n; s], {n, 50}] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, May 05 2017, Version 10.1 *)
xref: A091873 gives square roots. Cf. A038690, A029944, A068164.
results.author: _Amarnath Murthy_, Feb 25 2002
ext: Corrected and extended by _Ray Chandler_, Oct 11 2003
